verses.verse: Again it happened on the day<WH3117> when the God<WH430>'s sons<WH1121> came<WH935> to present<WH3320> themselves before Yahweh,<WH3068> that Satan<WH7854> came<WH935> also among<WH8432> them to present<WH3320> himself before Yahweh.<WH3068>

Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Satan,<WH7854> "Where<WH335> have you come<WH935> from?<WH7854>" Satan answered<WH6030> Yahweh,<WH3068> and said,<WH6030> "From going back and forth<WH7751> in the earth,<WH776> and from walking up and down in it.<WH1980>"

Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Satan,<WH7854> "Have you<WH7760> considered<WH3820> my servant<WH5650> Job?<WH347> For there is none like him in the earth,<WH776> a blameless<WH8535> and an upright<WH3477> man,<WH376> one who fears<WH3373> God,<WH430> and turns<WH5493> away from evil.<WH7451> He still maintains<WH2388> his integrity,<WH8538> although you incited<WH5496> me against him,<WH1104> to ruin him without cause.<WH2600>"
Satan<WH7854> answered<WH6030> Yahweh,<WH3068> and said,<WH6030> "Skin<WH5785> for skin.<WH5785> Yes,<WH376> all that a man has he will give<WH5414> for his life.<WH5315>
But<WH199> put forth<WH7971> your hand<WH3027> now,<WH5060> and touch his bone<WH6106> and his flesh,<WH1320> and he will renounce<WH1288> you to your face.<WH6440>"
Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Satan,<WH7854> "Behold,<WH3027> he is in your hand. Only spare<WH8104> his life.<WH5315>"

So Satan<WH7854> went<WH3318> forth<WH3318> from the presence<WH6440> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and struck<WH5221> Job<WH347> with painful<WH7451> sores<WH7822> from the sole<WH3709> of his foot<WH7272> to his head.<WH6936>
He took<WH3947> for himself a potsherd<WH2789> to scrape<WH1623> himself with,<WH3427> and he sat among<WH8432> the ashes.<WH665>
Then his wife<WH802> said<WH559> to him,<WH2388> "Do you still maintain your integrity?<WH8538> Renounce<WH1288> God,<WH430> and die.<WH4191>"

But he said<WH559> to her,<WH1696> "You speak as one<WH259> of the foolish women<WH5036> would speak.<WH1696> What?<WH1571> Shall we receive<WH6901> good<WH2896> at the hand of God,<WH430> and shall we not receive<WH6901> evil?<WH7451>" In all this Job<WH347> didn't<WH2398> sin with his lips.<WH8193>

Now when Job<WH347>'s three<WH7969> friends<WH7453> heard<WH8085> of all this evil<WH7451> that had come<WH935> on him,<WH376> they each came<WH935> from his own place:<WH4725> Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite,<WH8489> Bildad<WH1085> the Shuhite,<WH7747> and Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite,<WH5284> and they made an appointment<WH3259> together<WH3162> to come<WH935> to sympathize<WH5110> with him and to comfort him.<WH5162>

When they lifted up<WH5375> their eyes<WH5869> from a distance,<WH7350> and didn't<WH5234> recognize him,<WH5375> they raised their voices,<WH6963> and wept;<WH1058> and they each<WH376> tore<WH7167> his robe,<WH4598> and sprinkled<WH2236> dust<WH6083> on their heads<WH7218> toward the sky.<WH8064>

So they sat down<WH3427> with him on the ground<WH776> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> and seven<WH7651> nights,<WH3915> and none spoke<WH1696> a word<WH1697> to him,<WH7200> for they saw that his grief<WH3511> was very<WH3966> great.<WH1431>
